hanzi-su-wiki:
鯉

Значения

Карп

Мнемоника

Карп, рыба 魚, разводимая на заливных рисовых полях (расположены на расстоянии мили 里 от дома). Вода хорошо прогревалась, и мальки хорошо росли.

Варианты

鲤

(Simplified: 鲤)
Pictophonetic: 里 indicates the sound; 魚 (fish) conveys the meaning.
purpleculture_examples:
鯉魚 [ lǐ yú ]: carp
鯉城 [ lǐ chéng ]: Licheng district of Quanzhou city 泉州市 , Fujian
鯉城區 [ lǐ chéng qū ]: Licheng district of Quanzhou city 泉州市 , Fujian
鯉魚跳龍門 [ lǐ yú tiào lóng mén ]: to make a significant advance in one's career (idiom); to get one's big break

heisig_chinese_memo: Chinese carp are massive fish - they are measured in Chinese Li!
heisig_constituent: carp, fish, bound up, rice field, brains, oven-fire, barbecue, computer
heisig_story: These are the same carp you see in Japanese "carp streamers." Only here we find a small home computer or two strung on the line by a father anxious for his son not only to have the courage and determination of a carp swimming upstream, but also the efficiency and memory of a computer. Ugh.
koohiiStory1: Japanese carp are massive fish - they are measured in ri!
koohiiStory2: The fish got carpal tunnel syndrome from the computer(I know it´s lame but it´s hard to find a good story for this).
WaniKani_Meaning_Mnemonic: If you're in Japan (which is the end goal here, let's be honest) then the fish in your village are carp. You may know them as koi, too.
WaniKani_Meaning_Info: Picture your village in Japan. There's a big, still pond full of bright and beautiful giant carp. You hear the village kids giggle as they feed them and their big round mouths pop out of the water.
WaniKani_Reading_Mnemonic: A carp is called a koi (こい) in Japanese. We've used that word before so I hope you know it by now. A koi is a koi, you know?
WaniKani_Reading_Info: Carp are koi and koi are carp. Blub blub.
Ru_AutoNotes:
Карпы - род рыб из юго-восточной азии, обыкновенный карп (сазан) был расселён по всему свету и одомашнен. Их ловят в пищу, разводят в прудах.

Разноцветные карпы Кои.

В Японии словом "кой" (こい) называются любые карпы, на западе только разноцветные японские 錦鯉ニシキゴイ (букв. парчовые карпы).
Ru_Radicals: 杰, 田 (рисовое поле), 里 (родная деревня), 魚 (рыба)
Kanshudo_mnemonic: the village (里) fish (魚) is a carp
chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: Just like everyone has a computer, the carp is the standard fish that everyone knows.
humanum_full_description_en:
From " fish ", " in " sound. " Carp " is the name of a fish. The carp has a long and flat body, a yellow-white abdomen and a pale black back. It lives in fresh water. "Said Wen": "Carp, bonito. From the fish, the sound." Such as "Poetry. Guofeng. "Hengmen": "Why does it eat fish, but the carp in the river?" "Lu Shi Chunqiu. "Benwei": "The fish in the water is called the ray. It is like a carp and has wings. It often flies from the West Sea at night and swims in the East China Sea."

Seals in the Han Dynasty are often carved in the shape of fish. Han Yuefu "Yinma Great Wall Grottoes": "A guest came from afar, leaving me with a pair of carp. When you call a carp, there is a ruler book in it." Later, the letter was called "carp". For example, Li Shangyin in the Tang Dynasty "Send Linghu Langzhong": "Songyun Qin Shu left for a long time, and a book with two carps." It also means a messenger, such as Meng Haoran of the Tang Dynasty "Send Wang Daxiao's Letter": "The ruler can be generous, and time hope The Legend of the Carp."
humanum_short_description_en: From " fish ", " in " sound. " Carp " is the name of a fish. The carp has a long and flat body, a yellow-white abdomen and a pale black back. It lives in fresh water.
humanum_full_description:
從「魚」，「里」聲。「鯉」是魚名。鯉魚身體扁長，腹部黃白色，背部蒼黑色，生活在淡水中。《說文》：「鯉，鱣也。从魚，里聲。」如《詩．國風．衡門》：「豈其食魚，必河之鯉？」《呂氏春秋．本味》：「雚水之魚，名曰鰩，其狀若鯉而有翼，常從西海夜飛，游於東海。」

　　漢代的封檢常刻為魚形。漢樂府〈飲馬長城窟行〉：「客從遠方來，遺我雙鯉魚。呼兒烹鯉魚，中有尺素書。」後便以「鯉魚」代稱書信。如唐代李商隱〈寄令狐郎中〉：「嵩雲秦樹久離居，雙鯉迢迢一紙書。」又表示傳信人，如唐代孟浩然〈送王大校書〉：「尺書能不吝，時望鯉魚傳。」
humanum_short_description: 從「魚」，「里」聲。「鯉」是魚名。鯉魚身體扁長，腹部黃白色，背部蒼黑色，生活在淡水中。

①(鯉魚)體側扁，嘴邊有長短觸鬚各一對，肉可食。
②(鯉庭)指受父訓之處，亦借指父訓。
③書信的代稱，因中國唐代傳遞的書信以尺素結成雙鯉魚形。

從「 魚 」，「 里 」聲。「 鯉 」是魚名。鯉魚身體扁長，腹部黃白色，背部蒼黑色，生活在淡水中。《說文》：「鯉，鱣也。从魚，里聲。」如《詩．國風．衡門》：「豈其食魚，必河之鯉？」《呂氏春秋．本味》：「雚水之魚，名曰鰩，其狀若鯉而有翼，常從西海夜飛，游於東海。」 漢代的封檢常刻為魚形。漢樂府〈飲馬長城窟行〉：「客從遠方來，遺我雙鯉魚。呼兒烹鯉魚，中有尺素書。」後便以「鯉魚」代稱書信。如唐代李商隱〈寄令狐郎中〉：「嵩雲秦樹久離居，雙鯉迢迢一紙書。」又表示傳信人，如唐代孟浩然〈送王大校書〉：「尺書能不吝，時望鯉魚傳。」
From " fish", " in" sound. " Carp" is the name of a fish. The carp has a long and flat body, a yellow-white abdomen and a pale black back. It lives in fresh water. "Said Wen": "Carp, bonito. From the fish, the sound." Such as "Poetry. Guofeng. "Hengmen": "Why does it eat fish, but the carp in the river?" "Lu Shi Chunqiu. "Benwei": "The fish in the water is called the ray. It is like a carp and has wings. It often flies from the West Sea at night and swims in the East China Sea." Seals in the Han Dynasty are often carved in the shape of fish. Han Yuefu "Yinma Great Wall Grottoes": "A guest came from afar, leaving me with a pair of carp. When you call a carp, there is a ruler book in it." Later, the letter was called "carp". For example, Li Shangyin in the Tang Dynasty "Send Linghu Langzhong": "Songyun Qin Shu left for a long time, and a book with two carps." It also means a messenger, such as Meng Haoran of the Tang Dynasty "Send Wang Daxiao's Letter": "The ruler can be generous, and time hope The Legend of the Carp."

鯉字的基本解释

鯉
lǐ
见“鲤”。

鯉字的汉语字典释义

[①]［lǐ］
［《廣韻》良士切，上止，來。］
“鲤1”的繁体字。
(1)鲤鱼。
(2)喻指书信。
(3)见“鯪鯉”。

鯉字的康熙字典解释

【亥集中】【魚字部】　鯉； 康熙笔画：18； 页码：页1471第17
【唐韻】良止切【集韻】【韻會】兩耳切【正韻】良以切，?音里。【說文】鱣也。【爾雅·釋魚】鯉。【註】今赤鯉魚。【詩·?風】豈其食魚，必河之鯉。【陶弘景·本草】鯉最爲魚中之主，形旣可愛，又能神變，乃至飛越山湖，所以琴高乗之。【酉陽雜俎】道書以鯉多爲龍，故不欲食。【正字通】神農書曰：鯉爲魚王，無大小，脊旁鱗皆三十有六，鱗上有小黑點，文有赤白黃三種。○按《爾雅·釋魚》鯉、鱣二字相偶，無二名。毛公、《說文》誤謂《爾雅》以鱣釋鯉，遂合鱣、鯉爲一，非也。又唐制，佩用魚符，亦象鯉形。又書扎曰雙鯉。【古樂府】客從遠方來，遺我雙鯉魚。【李商隱詩】雙鯉迢迢一紙書。【註】古人尺素結爲鯉魚形，卽緘也。【類篇】亦作?。

鯉字的源字形

字源演变：

小篆楷体

字形对比：

中国大陆宋体台湾细明体香港明体日本明朝体韩国明朝体旧字形
鯉字的起名意思

暂无。

Kangxi dictionary interpretation of words
[Hai Collection] [Fish Character Department] 　Carp; Kangxi Strokes: 18; Page Number: Page 1471 Page 17
[Tang Yun] Liang Zhi cut [Ji Yun] [Yun Hui] Two ear cut [Zheng Yun] Liang Yi cut, in the sound. [Said the text] Bonito also. 【Erya·Shiyu】Carp. [Note] Red carp today. [Poetry·? Wind] How can it eat fish, it must be the carp of the river. [Tao Hongjing·Materia Medica] Carp is the most important fish in the world. It is lovely in shape and capable of supernatural change, even flying over mountains and lakes. 【Youyang Miscellaneous】The Taoist book uses carps as dragons, so they don’t want to eat. [Zhengzitong] The book of Shennong said: Carp is the king of fish, no size, 30 and six scales beside the ridge, small black spots on the scales, and three kinds of red, white and yellow in the text. ○According to "Erya·Shiyu", the two characters of carp and bonito are matched, and there is no two names. Mao Gong and "Shuowen" mistakenly said that "Erya" used bonito to explain carp, and then combined bonito and carp into one, no. It was also made in Tang Dynasty, and it was worn with fish symbols, which also resembled a carp. Then he wrote and said double carp. [Guyuefu] A guest came from afar, leaving me with double carps. 【Li Shangyin's Poems】Double carps and a paper book. [Note] The ancient ruler knot is in the shape of a carp. [Classes] Also for?.

lǐ
вм. 鲤
Radicals: 魚, 里  (fish, village)
Meaning Mnemonic
If you're in Japan (which is the end goal here, let's be honest) then the fish in your village are carp. You may know them as koi, too.
Picture your village in Japan. There's a big, still pond full of bright and beautiful giant carp. You hear the village kids giggle as they feed them and their big round mouths pop out of the water.
Reading Mnemonic
A carp is called a koi (こい) in Japanese. We've used that word before so I hope you know it by now. A koi is a koi, you know?
Carp are koi and koi are carp. Blub blub.

Карпы - род рыб из юго-восточной азии, обыкновенный карп (сазан) был расселён по всему свету и одомашнен. Их ловят в пищу, разводят в прудах.

Разноцветные карпы Кои.

В Японии словом "кой" (こい) называются любые карпы, на западе только разноцветные японские 錦鯉ニシキゴイ (букв. парчовые карпы).
